newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan money policy may change in mid-97 - executive.
newsitem.headline: Japan money policy may change in mid-97 - executive.

text.p: The chairman of the Japan Association of Corporate Executives, Jiro Ushio, said he feels there is a possibility that Japan's easy monetary policy may change towards the middle of the year, a spokesman for the association said on Tuesday.

"The effect of the rise in the consumption tax is relatively small, and the yen is falling versus the dollar in the foreign exchange markets due to a rise in U.S. interest rates. I think there will be new developments regarding interest rates in the future," Ushio was quoted as telling reporters at a news conference.
Ushio added that although he did not think there would be any immediate moves in interest rates, he wanted to keep a close watch on economic conditions in the April-June period.
